1542563372138389504 [2022-06-30] @C_Harwick 💜 3
Why be an originalist? Because without that ethos, everything is a raw power struggle and both sides can legitimately accuse the other of "rogue authoritarianism" when things don't go their way. https://t.co/Md2xat9viR https://t.co/akUxPOq4UN https://t.co/FooH0sTXTE
  [Quoting Tweet 1542510709937803264 (missing)]
Images:
  - [Image #0] The image presents a passage discussing the concept of originalist jurisprudence and its implications on political institutions. Here is a detailed transcription of the text in the image:
    
    "Perhaps, therefore, the wane of originalist jurisprudence has led straightforwardly to our present situation. Without a sense of fair political play within defined parameters, accepted arbitrarily and for their own sake, it becomes impossible to distinguish the political competitor from the political spoilsport. If the rules are flexible enough be reinterpreted for political expediency, who's to say which party is responsible for the increasing disregard for America's (or anyone else's) political institutions? If the boundaries between the game and the rest of one's life are blurred, it's not even clear when we've exited the game, or when it would be legitimate to do so. Small wonder that politics should be high-stakes and cutthroat under such circumstances!"
    
    This text is written in black font on a white background, making it easily readable.
↓

rating.reasoning_summary: This strand is a meta-commentary on recursive human failure, anchored by a missing viral tweet (1105577845642878976) that appears to be a 'sowing/reaping' or 'self-inflicted harm' meme. The boundary object is a Pokémon 'hurt itself in confusion' screenshot used as a template for expressing frustration with predictable negative outcomes. Rather than evolving the concept, participants repeatedly quote-tweet the same missing artifact across 5+ years (2019-2024) to express 'I am experiencing the thing again.' This is a **Static Ritual of Recognition** rather than knowledge production—people return to the same well when they need to express exasperation at cyclical mistakes, but no refinement occurs. The strand functions as a cultural timestamp (tracking what counts as 'ingroup meme' in 2021, appearing in Visa's 'favorite tweets' canon in 2022) but offers zero dialectical evolution or practical utility beyond commiseration.

essential_tweets.annotation: The missing origin tweet - appears to be the canonical 'sowing/reaping' or self-harm meme that anchors all subsequent references
2019: Visa's earliest use, establishing it as a 'metaphor for a lot of things'
The Pokémon 'hurt itself in confusion' image - the visual template for the meme
2021: Gnostrils collecting 'ingroup memes' - the strand becomes self-aware as cultural artifact
Mechanical_monk misattributes the meme to Dril, revealing folk etymology of internet culture
2022: Visa canonizes it in 'favorite tweets of all time' - cementing its status as evergreen
2022: 'Presented without comment' usage during geopolitical crisis - demonstrates pure ritual application
Legal Realists applying the meme to Supreme Court decisions - rare attempt at domain-specific adaptation
2024: 'Re-recognition' - explicit acknowledgment of cyclical return to the same realization
2024: UX designer using it for form design frustration - shows meme's persistence but not evolution
